awd_titl_txt: A Proposed Study of Techniques for Vertical Wind Profiling  Using Jicamarca at Low Power Levels
awd_abstract_narration: Abstract/Balsley 9614700          We propose to use the Jicamarca Radio Observatory near Lima, Peru  to examine a variety of multiple-receiver techniques that can be used for  vertical wind measurements in the troposphere and lower stratosphere.   These studies will use a series of sub-modules of the Jicarmarca antenna in  conjunction with a number of receivers.  The observations require only  low-power transmitters and minimal hands-on operation.  We will  intercompare a number of existing (and some new) techniques in order to  assess their strengths and weaknesses for vertical wind measurement.   The  Jicamarca observations will be complemented by modeling studies.   We anticipate that our results could ultimately serve as a basis for  improving conventional wind profiling techniques to provide improved  vertical wind measurements.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO
